org.whispercomm.c2dm4j
Interface Message

public interface Message

Encapsulates a request to the C2DM service. The message includes both the delivery metadata needed by C2DM (e.g., client identifier, collapse key, etc.) and the key-value data to be pushed to the client. Instances are immutable and can be obtained using MessageBuilder.

Full descriptions of the message fields can be found on the C2DM web page.

Author:
David R. Bild
See Also:
MessageBuilder

          Gets the identifier for the client to whom the message will be sent.
 

Method Detail

getRegistrationId

String getRegistrationId()
Gets the identifier for the client to whom the message will be sent.

Returns:
the registration id of the client.

getCollapseKey

String getCollapseKey()
Gets the collapse key for the message. The collapse key is used to collapse similar messages queued by the C2DM server when a device is offline. Only the last message will be delivered when the device reconnects.

Returns:
the collapse key

getData

Map<String,String> getData()
Returns the key-value pairs that will be delivered to the client.

Returns:
the key-value pair payload data

delayWhileIdle

boolean delayWhileIdle()
Indicates if message delivery should wait until the device is active. active. If false, the device will be woken up to receive the message.

Returns:
true if message delivery should wait until the device is active; false if it should be delivered immediately
